page.title: 05FARMING IN BOWERCHALKE
page.content: FARMING is the main Industry. This consists of the breeding of sheep & horses, the rearing of cows for milk and beef and arable farming. One farmer has a 7 acre vineyard; another runs a business in agricultural machinery trading abroad. The soil is greensand in the valley; on the slopes there is chalk about a foot down, whilst on the top of the hills the soil is clay & flint. There are 7 main farms between 600 & 1200 acres. Three smaller units for beef fattening are about 50 acres each - one is a tenant of the Local Authority. A smallholder rears rarer sheep for wool. Most of the farmers bear CONSERVATION in mind: one is replanting hedges, another reduces them to a minimum. Two farmers have planted small deciduous plantations. Stubble burning continues.
